level.text: Funds may be appropriated to carry out the purposes of this chapter.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 15-88 redesignated the existing section as subsec. (a); and added subsec. (b).

D.C. Law 17-219 repealed subsec. (b), which had read as follows: "(b) All provisions pertaining to marriage and family therapy added by the Marriage and Family Therapy Amendment Act of 2003, effective May 10, 2004, D.C. Law 15-88, 50 DCR 10999, shall be subject to the availability of appropriations."

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 6-99
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 6-99, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 3-1201.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 17-219
level.text: Law 17-219, the "Fiscal Year 2009 Budget Support Act of 2008", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-678, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 13, 2008, and June 3, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 26, 2008, it was assigned Act No. 17-419 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-219 became effective on August 16, 2008.
